Not all users have valid birth dates. Please complete missing birth data first.

These are the passwords for the initial login to the school cloud.
A new password must be chosen for the first login. Students who are at least 14 years old must also declare their consent when they log in for the first time.

pages.administration.students.index.tabl: Print registration links as QR Code
pages.administration.students.infobox.li: Send registration links via the school cloud to the e-mail addresses provided (also possible directly while importing/creating)
Print the registration links as QR sheets, cut them out and distribute the QR sheets to users (or their parents)
Waive off the digital collection of consents. Use the paper form instead and generate start passwords for your users (More info)
pages.administration.students.infobox.pa: You have the following options to guide the users for completion of the registration:
To do this, select one or more users, e.g. all students:inside a class. Then carry out the desired action.
Alternatively, you can switch to the Edit mode of the user profile and retrieve the individual registration link to send it manually by a method of your choice.

IMPORTANT: For students under 16 years of age, the first thing asked for during the registration process is the consent of a parent or guardian. In this case, we recommend the distribution of registration links as QR-sheets or retrieval of the links individually and sending them to the parents. After the parents have given their consent, the students receive a start password and can complete the last part of the registration on their own at any time. For use of the school cloud at primary schools, paper forms are a popular alternative.

From now on you will find high-quality content from our partner WirLernenOnline and much more.

Soon available:
  • By connecting Antares Content Access, we enable the easy integration of thousands of licensed content directly into the HPI School Cloud
  • Exclusive contents for individual federal states by tapping the contents of various state media centres
